sen.j: 大江 磐代（おおえ いわしろ、延享元年（1744年）- 文化 (元号)9年12月9日 (旧暦)（1813年1月11日））は、日本の皇族。
sen.e: Iwashiro OE (1744-January 11, 1813) was a member of Japan's imperial family.
Iwashiro OE (1744-January 11, 1813) was a member of Japan's Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Iwashiro OE (1744-January 11, 1813) was a member of Japan's Imperial Family.

sen.j: 閑院宮典仁親王の女房。
sen.e: She was a Nyobo(a court lady) who served Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito
She was a Nyobo (a court lady) who served the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito
sen.cmt: the を補いました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: She was a Nyobo (a court lady) who served the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito

sen.j: 光格天皇の生母で、明治天皇の高祖母にあたる。
sen.e: She was a real mother of Emperor Kokaku and great-great-grandmother of Emperor Meiji.
She was the real mother of the Emperor Kokaku and the great-great-grandmother of the Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: a→the と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She was the real mother of the Emperor Kokaku and the great-great-grandmother of the Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 延享元年（1744年）に伯耆国倉吉（鳥取県倉吉市）で、鳥取藩の家老荒尾氏の家臣だった父・岩室宗賢と、鉄問屋の娘であった母・おりんとの間に生まれる。
sen.e: She was born in Kurayoshi, Hoki Province (Kurayoshi City, Tottori Prefecture) in 1744 to a father, Soken IWAMURO who was a vassal of the Arao clan, a family of chief retainers of the Tottori Domain, and a mother, Orin who was a daughter of an iron wholesaler.
sen.cmt: 鉄問屋の定訳不明です。
sen.e: She was born in Kurayoshi, Hoki Province (Kurayoshi City, Tottori Prefecture) in 1744 to her father, Soken IWAMURO who was a vassal of the Arao clan, a family of chief retainers of the Tottori Domain, and her mother, Orin who was a daughter of an iron wholesaler.
sen.cmt: a father→her father,a mother→her mother と修正しました。
sen.e: She was born in Kurayoshi, Hoki Province (Kurayoshi City, Tottori Prefecture) in 1744 to her father, Soken IWAMURO who was a vassal of the Arao clan, a family of chief retainers of the Tottori Domain, and her mother, Orin who was a daughter of an iron wholesaler.
Her childhood name was Otsuru.
Her childhood name was Otsuru.
Her childhood name was Otsuru.

sen.j: 9歳のときに浪人して町医者となっていた父・宗賢とともに京都に上がる。
sen.e: When she was nine years old, she move to Kyoto with her father, Soken, who had turn Ronin (a masterless samurai) before becoming a town doctor.
She move to Kyoto at the age of nine, with her father, Soken, who had become a masterless samurai then became a town doctor.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: She move to Kyoto at the age of nine, with her father, Soken, who had become a masterless samurai then became a town doctor.

sen.j: 養女となり櫛笥家に仕えるなどの経緯をへて、十代のころには橘氏を名乗り「大江留子」として籌宮成子内親王の侍女となった。
sen.e: She, whose name was Tomeko OE at the time, became a waiting woman for Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Fusako after being adopted out and serving the Kushige family, while taking a different family name, Tachibana, in her teens.

After those stories including being adopted to and served the Kushige family, she took the name of the Tachibana clan in her teens, then as 'Tomeko OE,' she became a lady in waiting of the Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Fusako.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正し、全体的にスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: After those stories including being adopted to and served the Kushige family, she took the name of the Tachibana clan in her teens, then as 'Tomeko OE,' she became a lady in waiting of the Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Fusako.

sen.j: その後、成子内親王が閑院宮典仁親王に嫁ぐと磐代も女房として親王の寵愛を受け、三人の皇子をもうけた。
sen.e: Then, after Imperial Princess Fusako married Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito, Iwashiro also won his favor as a Nyobo and gave birth to three princes.
Then, after the Imperial Princess Fusako married the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito, Iwashiro also received his favor as a Nyobo and gave birth to three princes.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 won→received と修正しました。
sen.e: Then, after the Imperial Princess Fusako married the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito, Iwashiro also received his favor as a Nyobo and gave birth to three princes.

sen.j: その長男で閑院宮典仁親王第六王子・師仁親王は、皇子のいなかった後桃園天皇の第一皇女・欣子内親王を中宮に迎え即位した。
sen.e: Her oldest and Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito's sixth son, Prince Morohito, ascended the throne, taking the sonless Emperor Gomomozono's first Princess, Yoshiko, as a wife so that she could become Chugu (Empress).

Her oldest and the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito's sixth son, the Imperial Prince Morohito, ascended the throne, taking the sonless Emperor Gomomozono's first Princess, the Imperial Princess Yoshiko as the empress.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 Prince Morohito→Imperial Prince Morohito,Yoshiko→Imperial Princess Yoshiko,a wife→the empress,so that she could become Chugu (Empress) を削除しました。
sen.e: Her oldest and the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito's sixth son, the Imperial Prince Morohito, ascended the throne, taking the sonless Emperor Gomomozono's first Princess, the Imperial Princess Yoshiko as the empress.

sen.j: 天皇の生母としては、当時では異例の出自の低さであった。
sen.e: She was from an incredibly humble background as a real mother of an Emperor in those days.
She was from an incredibly humble background as a real mother of an emperor in those days.
She was from an incredibly humble background as a real mother of an emperor in those days.

sen.j: 典仁親王没後は出家して蓮上院となり、次男で聖護院門跡宮家を継いでいた閑院宮典仁親王第七王子・盈仁入道親王のもとで暮らした。
sen.e: After Prince Sukehito passed away, she entered into priesthood, was given the title of Renjoin, and lived with her second and Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito's seventh son, priestly Imperial Prince Einin, who had succeeded to the headship of the Shogoin family of monzeki (imperial priests).
sen.cmt: 蓮上院の読み方は確認できませんでしたので、一般的な読み方で表記してあります。
sen.e: After the Prince Sukehito passed away, she entered priesthood and became Renjoin, lived with her second son priestly Imperial Prince Einin, the seventh prince of the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito, who had succeeded to the headship of the Shogoin family of monzeki (imperial priests).
sen.cmt: the, を補いました。was given the title of→became,second→second son,スペースを修正しました。スムースに修正しました。
sen.e: After the Prince Sukehito passed away, she entered priesthood and became Renjoin, lived with her second son priestly Imperial Prince Einin, the seventh prince of the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito, who had succeeded to the headship of the Shogoin family of monzeki (imperial priests).

sen.j: 父・岩室宗賢もその縁で家臣に取り立てられ法橋の位を与えられていた。
sen.e: For that reason, her father, Soken IWAMURO was accepted as a vassal and appointed as Hokkyo (the third highest rank for Buddhist priests).
For that reason, her father, Soken IWAMURO was promoted to become a vassal and appointed to Hokkyo (the third highest rank for Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: accepted→promoted to be come,appointed as→appointed to と修正しました。
sen.e: For that reason, her father, Soken IWAMURO was promoted to become a vassal and appointed to Hokkyo (the third highest rank for Buddhist priests).

sen.j: 文化 (元号)9年（1812年）に69歳で没し、盧山寺に葬られた。
sen.e: She passed away in 1813 at the age of 69 and was buried in Rozan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 冒頭（上から二段目）の原文では死亡した年が文化9年12月9日 （1813年1月11日）となっており、死亡した年がこの原文と一致しておりませんが、こちらは文化９年だけで新暦に変換した為と思われるので冒頭の原文と一致させる為、こちらも1813年と訳出しております。
sen.e: She passed away in 1813 at the age of 69 and was buried in Rozan-ji Temple.
She passed away in 1813 at the age of 69 and was buried in Rozan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1878年に従四位、1902年に正一位を贈られた。
sen.e: She was posthumously conferred Jushi (Junior Fourth Rank) in1878 and Shoichii (Senior First Rank) in1902.
She was posthumously conferred Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) in1878 and Shoichii (Senior First Rank) in1902.
She was posthumously conferred Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) in1878 and Shoichii (Senior First Rank) in1902.
